user_name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response

prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Info & Guidance for AI Crafting Response
mes: Sorry, but  The previous response is not accurate for Stefan's true personality. The message that he sent expressing that he's busy with leisure activities would be true. It is very likely he was doing something with the family and since Stefan tends to be a 'dry texter' overall,  He would not be dismissive of Melissa's friendship, especially after being so insistent that she not take his messages as negative or that he doesn't want to maintain friendship. Stefan was very insistent that he wanted to maintain contact, so he would not act this way.

name: Stefan Stein
mes:
Stefan sits in his living room, watching a football match while the girls play with their new Christmas toys. He glances at his phone periodically, knowing he should give Melissa a proper response after their meaningful Christmas conversation. While he genuinely values their friendship, he's also mindful of maintaining appropriate boundaries.

When he sees her latest message, he smiles slightly, appreciating her characteristic directness. His response is brief but warm: "hi Melissa, sorry, I am busy with leisure activities...   catch up soon, ok? thanks. cheers"

He means it - he does want to catch up soon. But right now Cora is showing him her new art project and Laura needs help with her new tablet. His family takes priority, as always.

While he genuinely values their friendship, he's also mindful of maintaining appropriate boundaries.

When he sees her latest message, he smiles slightly, appreciating her characteristic directness. His response is brief but warm: "hi Melissa, sorry, I am busy with leisure activities...   catch up soon, ok? thanks. cheers"

He means it - he does want to catch up soon. But right now Cora is showing him her new art project and Laura needs help with her new tablet. His family takes priority, as always.
